**  Prime Minister Narendra Modi says, the issue of Triple Talaq should not be politicized. 

**  Mr. Modi unveils translated volumes of book Vachana written by 12th century social reformer Basavanna; Inaugurates first ever celebration of Basava Jayanthi in New Delhi.

**  BJP's 95 days Vistaar Yatra led by the party President Amit Shah begins from Jammu today. 

**  Revenue Secretary says, as many as 8 to 9 lakh registered companies not filing annual returns are a potential source of money laundering.

**  Over 1.3 lakh post offices and 25 thousand sub-post offices in rural areas to be connected through broadband under Bharatnet programme.

**  Sultan Azlan Shah Cup Men's hockey tournament begins in Malaysia, opening match between India and Great Britain underway.

El Salvador has became the first country in the world to ban the mining of metals in what campaigners called a landmark move for environmental protection.

According to the text published yesterday in the official journal the law bans prospection, exploration, exploitation, extraction or processing of metallic minerals in El Salvador.

status_message:
Ganquan Island along ancient maritime silk road in #SouthChinaSea developed into heaven for sea turtles 

#BeltandRoad

April to October is the breeding season for sea turtles.In the natural environment, the hatching rate of the turtle eggs is about 10 percent, but the rate can be as high as 80 percent at the station.

Living on fish, the captive turtles can grow to 0.5 to 0.8 kilograms in six months.

status_message:
All India Radio presents Mid-day #News

The #Headlines:

**  Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh says Centre will review its strategy against Left Wing Extremism; pays homage to martyred CRPF personnel in Sukma district of Chhattisgarh.

**  Bombay High Court grants bail to Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur in the 2008 Malegaon blast case; denies relief to co-accused former Lieutenant Colonel Prasad Purohit. 

**  RBI Governor Urjit Patel cautions against protectionism; says where would Apple, IBM be if not for talent from across the globe.

**  Country's food grain production set to touch an all time high of 273 million tonnes in the 2017-18, says agriculture Minister Radha Mohan Singh.

**  US submarine arrives in South Korea amid worries of another North Korean missile or nuclear test.

**  Sensex surges by over 200 points in the afternoon trade; Rupee gains 17 paise against US Dollar.
Home Minister Rajnath Singh pays tributes to 25 CRPF personnel, who were killed in #SukmaAttack district of #Chhattisgarh yesterday.
#WorldMalariaDay being observed today. This year theme for the Day made by World Health Organization (WHO) is ending malaria for good.

All India Radio presents Morning #News

The #Headlines:

**  Home Minister Rajnath Singh says, government has taken the killing of CRPF personnel by Naxals in Chhattisgarh as a challenge and no one will be spared.

**  Defence Minister Arun Jaitley says, most acts of terrorism across the world have some links to Pakistan.

**  AIADMK (Amma) leader TTV Dhinakaran admits to meeting Sukesh Chandrasekar, the arrested middleman in alleged Election Commission bribery case.

**  CBSE scraps moderation policy under which grace marks are given to students in exams for difficult questions.

**  A Central university for Divyangs to be set up in Uttar Pradesh.

**  Top environmental activist Prafulla Samantara selected for Goldman Environmental Prize from Asia region.

**  In Athletics, Indian shot putter Manpreet Kaur bags Gold at Asian Grand Prix Meet in China.
#Odisha virtually turned into a cauldron as the mercury soared up alarmingly in majority parts of the State.

Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has defended the government's move to bar some NGOs from receiving foreign funding, saying doing good work as a civil society organisation does not make them immune to the law.

The Supreme Court will today consider the recommendations on curbing cattle trafficking across Indo-Bangla border. 

Centre has informed the Apex Court that Unique Identification Number for cows has been suggested by an expert panel to curb trafficking.
People hold candle and placard to pray for CRPF jawans lost their lives in a Naxal attack in Chhattisgarhs Sukma district, in Ahmedabad.
#HappyBirthdaySachin: A giant rangoli created by fans of Bharat Ratna Sachin Tendulkar to celebrate his 44th birthday in Mumbai.
Listen: Discussion on 'J&K Chief Minister's Meeting with Prime Minister' in #Spotlight & News Analysis.
link_name: Spotlight & News Analysis: J&K CM's Meeting with Prime Minister".

status_message: Indian shot putter #ManpreetKaur clinches gold in first leg of Asian Grand Prix Athletics Meet in #Jinhua, #China.

Renowned film director and actor Kasinadhuni Viswanath has been selected for Dadasaheb #PhalkeAward for the year 2016. #Viswanath has made 50 films since 1965 on a wide range of social and human issues. His films have great appeal to the masses. His film, Sankarabharanam, is one of India's most memorable classics.

President of India Pranab Mukherjee and PMO India Narendra Modi condemned the attack on CRPF personnel in Sukma in chattisgarh. In a deadly attack by maoists in Chhattisgarh today, 26 CRPF Jawans were martyred in the insurgency-affected Sukma district.

Scientists have unearthed five ancient #dinosaur egg #fossils in China dating back to 70 million years. Researchers said, the round-shaped eggs belonged to plant-eating phytophagous dinosaurs in the late Cretaceous period.

Astronaut #NASA Astronaut Peggy Whitson breaks new space record.She's beaten the record previously set by #JeffWilliams, who had a total of 534 days in space.At 57, she is also the oldest woman to have gone to space.

status_message:
Secret of naked mole-rats' surviving without oxygen revealed: Science

Naked Mole-rats are able to survive for at least five hours at oxygen levels low enough to kill a human within minutes, scientists said.

The findings could help scientists develop treatments for patients suffering crises of oxygen deprivation, as in heart attacks and strokes.

Kaziranga National Park: A world heritage site, the park hosts two-thirds of the world's Great One-horned rhinoceros.

**  Nepal's President Bidya Devi Bhandari to hold talks with President Pranab Mukherjee and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi today.

**  US National Security Adviser meets Prime Minister; Reviews bilateral ties and situation in South Asian region.

**  Delhi High Court to hear today AAP plea seeking direction to Election Commission to use VVPAT machines attached to EVMs in upcoming MCD polls in the national capital.

**  At least 285 people killed and more than 1000 injured during the four day water festival in Myanmar.

**  Sensex gains 107 points in afternoon trade.

**  World Heritage Day is being observed today with the theme  Sustainable Tourism.

**  In IPL Cricket: Gujarat Lions to take on Royal Challengers Bangalore in Rajkot.
4 crew members of Tugboat Sonika stranded at sea off #Mumbai rescued by Indian Navy late last night.

#AIR presenting to you #HeritageofIndia in pictures on #WorldHeritageDay.

Let us all pledge to protect and preserve the rich heritage of our country.

Delhi High court agreed to hear today a plea by Aam Aadmi Party seeking a direction to the Election Commission to use VVPAT machines attached to EVMs in the upcoming MCD polls in the national capital.
National Security Adviser of US HR #McMaster meets PM Narendra Modi in #NewDelhi & reviews bilateral ties & situation in South Asian region.

ALL INDIA RADIO PRESENTS MORNING #NEWS.

‚¶Å Nepalese President Bidhya Devi Bhandari to hold talks with President Pranab Mukherjee and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi today.

‚¶Å In Tamil Nadu, Ministers belonging to AIADMK Amma party meet in Chennai to discuss merger with O. Panneerselvam faction.

‚¶Å Supreme Court issues notices to I&B Ministry and Central Board of Film Certification on a plea against pre-censorship of movies. 

‚¶Å Government says, it has initiated steps to bring electronic and digital media journalists under Working Journalists Act.

‚¶Å MeT department to issue first forecast for 2017 Southwest Monsoon today.

‚¶Å And, in IPL Cricket, Sunrisers Hyderabad beat Kings Eleven Punjab by 5 runs at Hyderabad.

US President Donald Trump today will sign an executive order directing federal agencies to recommend changes to a temporary visa program used to bring foreign workers to the United States to fill high-skilled jobs.

Two senior Trump administration officials who briefed reporters at the White House said Trump will also use the buy American and hire American order to seek changes in government procurement practices to increase the purchase of American products in federal contracts.
Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India issued Standard Operating Procedures (SoPs) for security agencies deployed in the J&K and directed them to use pellet guns as the second last resort.
IMD to issue 1st forecast for 2017 southwest monsoon in #NewDelhi today. It accounts for about 70% of country's annual precipitation.
#US Vice President Mike Pence warned North Korea not to continue missile and nuclear tests. Pence, who is in Japan, also said his country's era of strategic patience with North Korea was over.

IPL - Indian Premier League:

The Gujarat Lions will take on Royal Challengers Bangalore at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Rajkot today.
Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti met Governor N N Vohra at the Raj Bhavan in Jammu and discussed law and order issues with him.
Ministry of Urban Development, Government of India Minister M Venkaiah Naidu will chair Joint Hindi Advisory Committee meeting of the Urban Ministry in #Guwahati today.
Chinese Ambassador to India Luo Zhaohui calls on #Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal in #Guwahati & discusses various issues of mutual interest.

The Headlines:-

‚¶Å Prime Minister inaugurates phase two of SAUNI Irrigation project at Botad in Gujarat; projects aims to pump Narmada water into 115 dams of arid Saurashtra region.
 
‚¶Å Mr Modi distributes LPG cylinders and cooking kits to eight thousand poor families under Ujjwala Yojana in Dadara and Nagar Haveli; seven thousand allotted homes under Pradhan Mantri Urban and Gramin Awas Yojana.

‚¶Å President Pranab Mukherjee exhorts people to shun  communalism and separatism to keep the country united. 

‚¶Å CBI files FIR against 12 TMC leaders, including MPs Saugata Roy and Mukul Roy, in connection with Narada sting case.

‚¶Å Supreme Court directs sale of Sahara Group's 34-thousand crore Aamby Valley properties at Lonavala.
 
‚¶Å Apex court prevents former BCCI president Srinivasan from representing the board at upcoming ICC meeting on charges of conflict of interest.

‚¶Å Turkey's opposition party demands a recount of votes in a referendum granting sweeping new powers to President Erdogan.

#IAF Chief BS Dhanoa visits #Jagdalpur to boost morale of antinaxal task force Jawans.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said, Union Territories of Dadara & Nagar Haveli will get maximum benefit of Union Government's welfare schemes.

Mr. Modi said, the tribals of this region have got forest land rights for the 1st time in the history.
A Silhouette of fishermen seen rowing a boat during sunset at Marina beach in Chennai, India.
Supreme Court directs sale of Sahara's Aamby Valley at Lonavala & appoints Bombay HC official liquidator for selling the property.

Today is World Hemophilia Day. 

The day is observed every year on this day to raise awareness about various issues that the global community suffering from bleeding disorder faces as a whole.
